results.title: Rana
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The story of a young Muslim girl student living in a crowded section of Old Delhi. The customary veiling of women (Purdah) and impending marriage by arrangement are examined.

results.title: Questions
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The “God rich colony” is a huge industrial estate on the outskirts of Bombay. It is a self-contained company town where everything is provided for the factory workers and their families, including schools. An Australian director and a group of 15 year-old school children have a relaxed discussion about their concept of the Australian way of life and their lives in India.

results.title: Puppeteer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
Depicts the modified way of life of a traditional Rajasthan puppeteer in Vdaipur today. Living in a tent on a street corner, Bansilal works in a superb Maharajah’s Palace, now converted to a five star hotel.

results.title: Bombay movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
Vinod Kharna is one of the most popular Hindi movie stars in Bombay’s film industry. This film explores his life and work as a way of gaining insight into Indian “pop culture”.

results.title: Bijan
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Bruce Moir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
A personal look at the life of Bijan Choudhury, an artist who lives in a village close to Calcutta. Through his paintings we gain an inside impression of Calcutta and the differences between living in a city and living in a quiet village. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Noonan, Bruce Moir and Film Australia

results.title: Temple of twenty pagodas
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Northern Island is a monastery said to be two thousand years old. It is called “Wa Chedi Sao”, which in Northern Thai means the Temple of Twenty Pagodas. This film is about the daily life of the monastery and the village which it serves.

results.title: Ka Rorn: southern village
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
At 3am the village of Ka Rorn comes to life and work begins. Produce must be taken to market in Phuket, the only major town on the island. Ka Rorn is a tight, relaxed, self-sufficient community of about 30 families. The people grow coconuts and fruit to sell in the market but, being an island village, fishing is the most lucrative industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
